general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Welcomed the new Commissioner, Shant Chakerian, and encouraged him to introduce himself and share his interests in sustainability.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Chakerian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed his pleasure to be part of the committee, mentioned his background as a former engineer, now an attorney in intellectual property, with experience in inventions and technologies related to alternative fuels and sustainability, and his excitement to help Glendale move forward in its goals towards greater sustainability. He also said he wants to get adoption of making the city a place with clean air, clean water, and a great place to live.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Welcomed Commissioner Chakerian.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Welcomed Commissioner Chakerian.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Asked about the process for submitting a comment letter, referencing a previous letter introduced by former Commissioner Alec regarding drive-throughs.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff (Julian)
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed the letter regarding drive-throughs was submitted to the City Manager and provided to Council, and that if another commissioner wanted to submit a letter, it would need to be agendized.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed interest in agendizing a letter about outreach that the commission could do to the community, suggesting a speaker series or field trips to major infrastructure dealing with sustainability and will bring a draft letter to the next meeting.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: City Staff (Julian)
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Explained he'd have to find out whether permission from the City Council is needed for the commission to conduct outreach and would bring his recommendations to the next meeting.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Seconded agendizing the letter.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Announced that the state of California officially announced that Styrofoam or expanded polystyrene food ware is banned statewide, and that she sees still stores selling that in Glendale, and they should not be.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Clarified that the statewide Styrofoam ban is effective immediately.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Clarified EPS refers to expanded polystyrene or foam foodware, and it's foodware only, not other EPS products.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: One of the proposed projects is going to be held in about two weeks, the prom teen clothing swap in the Glendale Central Library Teen Center and so they're very excited about that and they're promoting it through the social media apps and whatnot.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Share that they will get into the Earth Day Fair more in a later agenda part, but that was another part of the student commissioner projects which has now passed, so we'll get on it later.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Asked the Student Commissioner to share more about the clothing swap.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: It is going to be inspired by the usual clothing swaps held by the Sustainability Commission, but it's centered more on a teen audience because we want to reach out to people our age to learn more about sustainable practices and through a more accessible way, which is through a clothing swap, since it's prom season, people are looking to buy dresses and to not spend as much they could just hop in the library and look for some.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Questioned if the clothing swap would be a venue to promote against fast fashion, which is fashion manufactured to last little, probably months less than a year and then you toss it.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Part of the proposal that Samantha had was to have some education against fast fashion, too, and the reason that the student commissioners proposed the idea in the first place was to, you know, have a different channel that wasn't subscribing to fast fashion. She also shared there is a tailor, a photo booth and makeup artist to do some consultations, as well as goody bags.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Vice Chair Kartunian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Stated it was very impressive.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Concluded the item with remarks about the state of things and headwinds on sustainability and environmental work at all levels, but certainly at the federal level, commended fellow commissioners and city staff for their continued work, said they are all in it together, and thanked everyone for their commitment to the commission.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Wanted to wish former Sustainability Commissioner, Alec Bartersian good luck on the Transportation Commission that he's now on, said that he was one of the original commissioners along with Commissioner Pinkerton, Vice Chair Kartunian, and herself, and they hope that he does great things on his new commission.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Basmajian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Said they hope that he comes and speaks as needed because I'm sure we would value his input from the audience.

oral_communications.speaker: Alan Deesh
oral_communications.comment: Talked about Earthday and the trees being cut down at North Central by the new mayor who was selected. He requested that some stronger measures to be imposed on cutting the trees, because they were sequoias. He says that the mayor have a wonderful reply, but cannot impose stronger measures because of the charter. He stated that he went to the Chater Commision, as well. Says we are apporaching complex but urgent situation such as the fire. He says the way to do it, is to have a charasmatic leader, such as what Franklin Roosevelt did.
